intro: Dissochaeta diepenhorstii, commonly known as Diepenhorst's dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
